marytts.server

Class RequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • marytts.server.RequestHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class RequestHandler
extends Thread
    A lightweight process handling one Request in a thread of its own. This is to be used when running as a socket server.
    Author:
    Marc Schröder

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestHandler

        public RequestHandler(Request request,
              Socket infoSocket,
              Socket dataSocket,
              Reader inputReader)
        Constructor to be used for Socket processing (running as a standalone socket server). inputReader is a Reader reading from from dataSocket.inputStream(). Passing this on is necessary because the mary server does a buffered read on that input stream, and without passing that buffered reader on, data gets lost.
        Parameters:
        request - request
        infoSocket - infoSocket
        dataSocket - dataSocket
        inputReader - inputReader

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Perform the actual processing by calling the appropriate methods of the associated Request object.

        Note that while different request handlers run as different threads, they all use the same module objects. How a given module deals with several requests simultaneously is its own problem, the simplest solution being a synchronized process() method.

        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class Thread
        See Also:
        Request, MaryModule, ExternalModule, InternalModule
